reviews.review_msg: I met Dr. Goldner back in my first year when I decided to take HSCI 214. At the time I was struggling between my interest for kinesiology and health sciences. This man made me fall in love with health sciences and mental health through his passion and advocacy. I was struggling with mental health problems at the time and his class truly inspired me
A great professor with enthusiasm. God bless his soul and may his  teaching memory last forever. Waheguru ji ki fateh.

I thought maybe I was the only one to write here, but yes he was truly a kind and understanding professor. I didn't do too well on his midterm, but he went through the exam in its entirety and made sure I understood why the answers were wrong versus right. You can't say many professors will do that for you. Rest in peace, Dr. Goldner.

I'm not sure why, but Dr. Goldner truly touched my heart.  I had the pleasure of getting to know him over the past 3 months, and he is the most amazing man.  I will always remember his Matt & Nat backpack as he walked into lecture.  I was so jealous of that bag.  Rest in peace, Goldner.  I hope you know that you helped so many people.

Rest in Peace Dr. Goldner. An intriguing class taught by a brilliant man. Your expertise in the field of psychiatry and mental health made this class engaging and informative. One of the best classes of my degree, and I only wish I made this review sooner. The SFU community will feel this loss for a long time.

Rest in peace Dr. Goldner. May your spirit fly high and you rest easy knowing the thousands of people you have helped through your roles as a doctor, professor, and world renowned researcher. I feel very fortunate to have been in your final class, and to have witnessed your kindness and passion. You are the epitome of brilliance.

Absolutely incredible professor. Ends class early and allows students who have specific questions to come down and ask. Very kind and really cares that his students do well! Course is well structured with 1 midterm, 2 easy assignments, and one final. He wrote the textbook himself so exam questions are verbatim text from the book.

Does not reply to e-mails. Wants you to participate but impossible to get a good participation mark after getting well above 90% on every other component and participating every tutorial and doing the bonus submissions. Dumb grading system, though a very easy class for exams etc

Amazing prof. Heavy participation grade, but if you're interested in the subject the lectures are fantastic. Exams based entirely on textbook questions and are straight-forward. If you're interested in the course it will show on your final grade. Overall great guy, hope I have more courses with him in the future

He's an awesome prof. Very passionate with the material and runs the lectures incredibly smooth. The lectures were long but he always finished early. You have to read the textbook but as long as you do that and do the questions you're good, the midterm was completely text based.  Would definitely recommend. Great guy overall.

I loved this class. The format of it is just about perfect (the midterm and test are a bit tricky with like 40 mc), tutorials were engaging and helpful. Txtbook is absolutely mandatory, as all the test questions are from the text. It is an easy  great read! Elliot is amazing,  funny & truly cares about what he is teaching. Defs recommend!

Kind professor that's clearly passionate about what he teaches. Your exam mark reflects that the time and detail that you put in while reading his textbook. Participate as much as you can!! It'll make or break an AA+. Would absolutely take again, interesting class with a great professor.

His lectures are very engaging through use of guest speakers, multiple videos, and allowing the class to give input. Midterm and final are tricky, but totally doable if you read the textbook. Do the critical thinking questions at the end of each chapter! I-clicker quizzes in class for participation, tutorials mandatory.

Very easy class. Midterm and final were tough multiple choice q's but it's so easy to score highly in everything else that you'll do well. Incredibly friendly professor who knows a lot about this subject
Excellent proff.! Very laid back, calm class, but you still end up learning a lot. Absolutely fantastic!

Dr. Goldner is an excellent, fair and approachable prof.  Mental health is an interesting course as it is and Goldner engages you further by involving students in discussion(sometimes even controversial ones) and genuinely respects and appreciates student responses.  Easily one of the best courses I've taken both due to the prof and the material

Every professor should be like Dr. Goldner. Genuinely nice guy and very fair! His exams were a walk in the park if you just did your readings! He also motivates you to speak up in class. I would totally recommend this, because he makes the class atmosphere comfortable enough for you to do so!

awesome prof, took this class in the summer and never went to a class expect for midterm & final and handing in assignments. his exams are based straight out of the txtbook, class is not mandatory at all unless you like watching a bunch of youtube videos. highly recommend taking this course.
Goldner was an amazing prof! Really helpful, down to earth and easy to approach! The lectures were textbook based but very interactive and interesting with lots of videos and interactive questions.

Wonderful prof!!! He really wants students to succeed. Classes were boring for some people since everything he talks about is in the book but I found them pretty interesting. Midterms and finals were all multiple choice with material ONLY from the textbook. We had a lot of guest lectures which helped keep things interesting.

Elliot's lectures are easy to follow and he keeps your attention with a lot of interesting videos. Marks based on 1 mt, 1 assignment, and the final. All of his exams were MC and mostly straight out of the textbook.
THE BEST PROF..!!!

Prof. Goldner is an awesome instructor! However, if you get landed with the T.A. Rose Schmidt try to get into another tutorial! She doesn't do a good job at all as a T.A. and makes this class unnecessarily stressful and can sometimes be very unfair.

I loved this class! Goldner was very engaging and his lectures were very interesting; he's very knowledgeable and genuinely interested in mental health. The 2 assignments were very easy and worth 30%. Midterm was 40M/C. He wasn't around for the final unfortunately. I'd definitely recommend him and I'll be looking to take his UD HSCI class later on.
very interesting to talk to, and he is very engage in his lectures
I really enjoyed him as a prof. Very easy in follow and understand, his midterm was really easy, all you have to do is read the textbook

This class was taught by both Dr.Goldner as well as Dr.Somers and Goldner was less involved with the students so it's hard to rate him accurately.  However, from the few lectures that he ran he seemed like a nice guy who was really trying to engage the students in the lecture.  He also seems to have a genuine interest in mental health.
